## Gene Details:
- **Gene ID:**	[Glyma.08G029200](https://legacy.soybase.org/sbt/search/search_results.php?category=FeatureName&version=Wm82.a4.v1&search_term=Glyma.08G029200)
- **Gene Symbol:** <u>GmACO1</u>
- **Gene Name:** ACC oxidase 1
- **Genome:** [Wm82.a4.v1](https://legacy.soybase.org/GlycineBlastPages/blast_descriptions.php)
- **Species:** *Glycine max*

## Functional Descriptions:
   - Natural **GmACO1** allelic variations confer drought tolerance and influence nodule formation in soybean.
   - Determined that **GmACO1** expression was reduced after rhizobial infection, and that **GmACO1** negatively regulated soybean nodule formation.
   - Allelic analysis and genetic validation demonstrated that **GmACO1**, encoding for a 1-aminocyclopropane-1-carboxylate oxidase, was the causal gene in this association locus, and positively regulated drought tolerance in soybean.
   - Overexpression of **GmACO1** improved drought tolerance, whereas RNA interference (RNAi) transgenic lines exhibited the opposite phenotype.
   - **GmACO1** was the causal gene in the QTN (quantitative trait nucleotides) located on Chr. 8, and it plays a positive role in conferring drought tolerance in soybean.
